summary:
Experience as an e-science enabler by capacitating researchers to produce science in infrastructure distributed environments, such as grid and cloud. I embrace the ideas of IT Service Management for a professional approach to service delivery. Was involved in multiple projects, namely in European Projects funded by the European Commission in Infrastructure & distributed computing areas.

► Specialties

✓ Technical User Support
✓ Scientific Computing

treasury_media.title: EOSC Service Portfolio Roadmap
treasury_media.description:
This document lists high level service capabilities that should be part of the EOSC Service Portfolio
offering. The input analysed was collected from the EOSCpilot Science Demonstrators, the early
adopters of EOSC Services, and from EOSC engagement with ESFRI clusters and general EOSC
stakeholders at events. A roadmap is proposed based on the findings.

projects.title: CompBioMed
projects.description:
Computational Methods, based on human biology, are now reaching maturity in the biomedical domain, rendering predictive models of health and disease increasingly relevant to clinical practice by providing a personalized aspect to treatment. Computer based modelling and simulation is well established in the physical sciences and engineering, where the use of high performance computing is now routine. 
CompBioMed is a user-driven Centre of Excellence in Computational Biomedicine, to nurture and promote the uptake and exploitation of high performance computing within the biomedical modelling community. Our user communities come from academia, industry and clinical practice.

This project has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under grant agreement No 675451. This project is funded under H2020-EU.1.4.1.3. - Development, deployment and operation of ICT-based e-infrastructures.

contributors.headline: Sr. Advisor at SURF

projects.title: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Facility
projects.description:
The Laboratory of Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (Laboratório de Ressonância Magnética Nuclear, L-RMN) of the Chemistry Centre of Coimbra provides to its customers, researchers from academia and the business community, and public / private institutions, a centre devoted to structural and dynamic characterization of materials and new compounds synthesized or isolated from several sources using NMR spectroscopy.

The funding provided by the Foundation for Science and Technology under the National Programme for Scientific Re-equipment (2001-2007) (Project REEQ / 481 / QUI / 2006-POCI 2010 and FEDER, Portugal), as well as co-funding Faculty of Science and Technology and Dean of University of Coimbra enabled the realization of this lab.

Main duties:
* Corporate website manager / editor
* Setup the computational infrastructure of the NMR lab
* Development & maintenance of in-house Bruker NMR accounting solution

projects.title: EOSCpilot
projects.description:
The EOSCpilot project will support the first phase in the development of the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC). It will:

- Propose and trial the governance framework for the EOSC and contribute to the development of European open science policy and best practice;

- Develop a number of demonstrators functioning as high-profile pilots that integrate services and infrastructures to show interoperability and its benefits in a number of scientific domains; and

- Engage with a broad range of stakeholders, crossing borders and communities, to build the trust and skills required for adoption of an open approach to scientific research.

These actions will build on and leverage already available resources and capabilities from research infrastructure and e-infrastructure organisations to maximise their use across the research community.

- Reduce fragmentation between data infrastructures by working across scientific and economic domains, countries and governance models, and

- Improve interoperability between data infrastructures by progressing and demonstrating how data and resources can be shared even when they are large and complex and in varied formats.

The EOSCpilot project will improve the ability to preserve and reuse data resources and provide an important step towards building a dependable open innovation environment where data from publicly funded research is always open and there are clear incentives and rewards for the sharing of data and resources.

Role: Support WP5 - Services, and Task Leader (T5.2): EOSC Service Portfolio

contributors.headline: Sr. Advisor at SURF

projects.title: BioVeL
projects.description:
BioVeL (Biodiversity Virtual e-Laboratory) is a FP7 EU project supporting biodiversity research using large amounts of data from cross-disciplinary sources.  BioVeL focuses on the further development and evolution of the high-capacity and high-performance communication network (GÉANT), distributed computing infrastructures (grids and clouds), supercomputer infrastructures, simulation software, scientific data infrastructures, e-Science services as well as on the adoption of e-Infrastructures by user communities. The project offers researchers the possibility of using computerised workflows to process data.

I took support coordination roles in topics such as sustainability plans, and technical support / consultancy for project partners to port web-service applications to EGI.eu federated cloud e-infrastructure.

projects.title: EGI-InSPIRE
projects.description:
The EGI-InSPIRE project (Integrated Sustainable Pan-European Infrastructure for Researchers in Europe) started on 1 May 2010, co-funded by the European Commission (contract number: RI-261323) for four years, as a collaborative effort involving more than 50 institutions in over 40 countries. Its mission is to establish a sustainable European Grid Infrastructure (EGI). EGI-InSPIRE is ideally placed to join together the new Distributed Computing Infrastructures (DCIs) such as clouds, supercomputing networks and desktop grids, for the benefit of user communities within the European Research Area.

I was involved in European user support coordination roles.

projects.title: e-NMR infrastructure
projects.description:
e-NMR (Deploying and unifying the NMR e-Infrastructure in system biology) is an FP7 EU project that aims at providing the bio-NMR community with a software platform integrating and streamlining computational approaches necessary for NMR data analysis. The e-NMR e-infrastructure, a gLite middleware enabled grid, is composed of several partners sharing computational resources. A main focus of the consortium is to provide services through easy-to-use web interfaces, while retaining customization features to handle requests by expert users. Various programs relevant for structural biology scientists are grid ported and already available through the e-NMR web portal, including HADDOCK, XPLOR-NIH, CYANA and CS-ROSETTA among others. The e-NMR community is currently the second largest virtual organization (enmr.eu) in the Life Sciences. The state of the project can be found on the web page http://www.enmr.eu.

Grid System Administration and user support were my main tasks.

profile_positions.description:
★ Grid & Cloud scientific computation enabler

The activities focused at enabling researchers from the European Research Area with technical skills to achieve the most from the worldwide distributed e-infrastructure coordinated by EGI.eu. The work was funded by two European FP7 projects, namely EGI-InSPIRE and BioVeL. The activities were broad in scope and aligned with the organization service catalogue.

► Responsibilities

✓ Lead the setup of distributed projects (enables researchers to profit from the service catalogue)
✓ Commissioning distributed support teams to undertake work and monitor progress
✓ Product owner of EGI Marketplace service (2 years)
✓ Liaise Customers with Policy, Operations and Resource Providers distributed teams
✓ Support coordination of training activities
✓ Support technical consultancy in grid & cloud technologies
✓ Support coordination of resources allocation (computing & data)
✓ Translate customer requests to functional requirements regarding EGI service portfolio
✓ Process requirements from customers regarding deployed technology
✓ Writing, review and dissemination of non-/technical documentation to a broad audience
✓ Convene international event sessions on Science Gateways technologies

► Responsibilities
